briefTitle: A Study of Monthly Subcutaneous Mircera for the Treatment of Chronic Renal Anemia in Predialysis Patients Not Treated With ESA.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Change in Hb Concentration Between Baseline and the Efficacy Evaluation Period
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean change in Hb concentration was calculated as the difference between the time adjusted average of Hb during the efficacy evaluation period (EEP \[Week 29 to Week 36\]), and the Hb at Baseline (Week 0). A positive change from baseline indicates improvement.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Time to Achievement of Response During the EEP
outcomeMeasures.description: Participants with Hb concentrations within target range of 10-12 g/dl were considered to be responders. Mean time to achievement of response during the EEP (Week 29 to Week 36) is presented.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Percentage of Participants Whose Hb Concentrations Remained Within the Target Range of 10.0- 12.0 g/dLThroughout the EEP
outcomeMeasures.description: The percentage of participants whose Hb Concentrations remained within the target range of 10.0- 12.0 g/dL throughout the EEP (Week 29 to Week 36) is presented.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Time Spent by Participants in the Target Range of 10.0- 12.0 g/dL During the EEP
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean time spent by participants in the target range of 10.0- 12.0 g/dL during the EEP (Week 29 to Week 36) is presented.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants Requiring Dose Adjustments During Dose Titration Period and EEP
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage of participants requiring dose adjustments during dose titration period (DTP \[Week 0 to Week 28\]) and EEP (Week 29 to Week 36) is presented. The dose adjustments (increase or decrease) were required: if a single Hb concentration was either ≥ 13 g/dL or \< 9 g/dL; if the difference of 2 consecutive Hb concentrations was ≥2 g/dL; if the values of scheduled Hb assessments on the day of administration of C.E.R.A. and on the previous study visit were both out of range of 10 to 12 g/dL; if the values of the scheduled Hb assessments on the day of administration of C.E.R.A. and on the previous study visit were both out of the range 10.5 to 11.5 g/dL. Dose adjustment could be made at any time at the discretion of the clinician if clinically warranted.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Who Received Red Blood Cell Transfusions During the Study Period
outcomeMeasures.description: Red blood cell transfusions were given during the treatment period in case of medical need. Blood transfusions occurred during the DTP (Week 0 to Week 28), EEP (Week 29 to Week 36), and during the long term safety period (LSTP \[Week 37 to Week 52\]) are presented.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Who Experienced Any Adverse Events or Serious Adverse Events
outcomeMeasures.description: An adverse event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with this treatment. An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product. A serious adverse event (SAE) is any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, are life threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or results in disability/incapacity, and congenital anomaly/birth defect.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Hb Concentration Over Time
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean change from Baseline in Hb concentration was calculated as the difference between Baseline and post-baseline measurements. It was recorded for each participant at enrollment (Week 0) and at different time points during the study up to Week 48.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Hematocrit Level Over Time
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean change from Baseline in hematocrit level was calculated as the difference between Baseline and post-baseline measurements. It was recorded for each participant at enrollment (Week 0) and at different time points during the study up to Week 48.

outcomeMeasures.description: Mean change from Baseline in erythrocyte mean corpuscular volume was calculated as the difference between Baseline and post-baseline measurements. It was recorded for each participant at enrollment (Week 0) and at different time points during the study up to Week 48.

outcomeMeasures.description: Mean change from Baseline in white blood cells (WBCs) and platelets concentrations was calculated as the difference between Baseline and post-baseline measurements. It was recorded for each participant at enrollment (Week 0) and at different time points during the study up to Week 48.
